3095ba19-26c5-45c3-8adf-164e2c174a8c.race_name: Online Form Guide Www.Gallop.Co.Za Mr 65 Handicap

race_form.race_comment: LULU'S BOY (12) was not disgraced when finishing fifth over 1200m last time. He does have a wide draw to overcome but is likely to use his early gate speed to get across without using up too much energy. He may be hard to peg back in the run to the line and rates as one of the hardest to beat. GEORGIE GEORGE (11) ran a good race to finish third at long odds in his last start over 1000m when resuming from a spell. He takes a drop in class and if suited to the polytrack can figure in the finish. PHAKA IMALI (7) won a good race in his last start over this course and distance. He was settled at the rear of the field and finished his race off strongly. If repeating that effort in this field he can follow up. LORD EDWARD (6) was doing his best work at the finish over this course and distance last time. If jumping on equal terms terms with his rivals should run a big race.

QUEENS GAMBLE (7) won her first two races on the flat at Cheltenham before reappearing in February finishing second to a subsequent winner at Market Rasen. Was midfield back at Cheltenham when last seen in March and rates a clear danger on jumps debut. NIGHT ON THE TOWN (6) has placed once from three starts on the flat. Returns to action after nine months and is worth a market check. EMILY'S STAR (4) provides her third hurdle outing and may place while ENERGY TWO (9) will be aiming to build on her third placed effort last time at Wincanton racing third-up.

7870eefa-3145-468e-9f84-eb32e9e56d83.race_name: Kempton Park Working With The Community Novices' Hurdle (Gbb Race)

race_form.race_comment: FATHER OF JAZZ (4) is a three-time winner on the AW. Makes his fourth start over hurdles and first for a new trainer. Interesting runner racing second-up following wind surgery and is one to watch in the market. Feared. MOONSHINE SPIRIT (7) was not disgraced when fourth of twelve on hurdle debut in February. No surprise if he has improved since. Can make his presence felt. IOLAOS DU MOU (6) looked promising landing a Newbury jumpers flat in November. Consider on initial hurdle outing. DUHALLOW TOMMY (3) is another former jumpers flat winner who may go well on his first attempt with hurdles.
race_form.additional_data: {"revealed_race_info":{"track_name":"Kempton Park","state":"UK","country":"UK","number":1,"race_name":"Kempton Park Working With The Community Novices' Hurdle (Gbb Race)","time":"2023-05-01T12:53:13.427273349Z"}}

race_form.race_comment: This may lie between the two last-time-out winners HERCULANEUM (5) and I DON'T GET IT (6). Narrow preference goes the way of the former who won a handicap hurdle at Naas late last month and can win again while the latter made all at Downpatrick and is respected off 3kg higher. WARM IN GOREY (10) finished runner-up in that Downpatrick handicap hurdle and could give a bold sight. First-time hood might bring out more from the lightly-raced PRINCESS SOPHIA (9).

abc098a8-cd14-4784-9cbb-2b03c6661446.race_name: At The Races Form Study Apprentice Training Series Handicap

race_form.race_comment: STONE CIRCLE (2) won by a nose a 1050m handicap at Yarmouth. Taken to follow up. BEZZAS LAD (3) placed second beaten 0.8L attempting 1200m on the AW at Lingfield. Leading contender revisiting turf. ANTIPHON (1) took a step forward when 1.7L fourth tackling 1050m in a handicap at Yarmouth. Danger to all. FIRENZE ROSA (6) found success here in the past. Capable of going well following a 4.3L second over 1200m at this venue a week ago.
